stories.text:
My primary browser is Chrome. And it works great for me except when it comes to Google Meet. If more that one person is in the call it is totally unusable if I use external USB camera. I've tried using it with two difference cameras (both from Logitech), and result is the same. If I switch to built in camera on laptop - everything si great. If I open Google Meet in Firefox - external USB cameras work great.

Is there some plugin for Chrome that would tell "If the domain is meet.google.com start Firefox and go to that URL"?
stories.title: Ask HN: Can links for Google meet be forced to opet with Firefox?
Substrait: Cross-Language Serialization for Relational Algebra
Opera shows ads for own products on competitor's websites

stories.text:
Me and my girlfriend are planning to go to Thailand. Today we got another email from the Thailand pass people (needed for entry):

  There is a problem related to the request, please download the attachment and update the information.

  Please prepare your documents for submission at the check-in desk and relevant agencies
  Passport with visa (if required)
  Thailand pass QR code (on mobile device or hard copy)

  Download Document

  https://bit.ly/XXXXXXXXXXX

  important note. You must open the document from a PC and not from the phone
The link is leading to an HTML file hosted on discord, which is prompting the user to download some malicious VBS code.

It's easy to detect for technically apt people, but it almost fooled my girlfriend.
stories.title: Tell HN: Thailand pass applicants receive malicious code via email
